title: Responsible modelling in infectious disease epidemiology
text:
Date: 24 March 2026
Location: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, UK

This one-day workshop brings together the infectious disease modelling community to explore responsible practices across the modelling lifecycle. With a strong focus on evaluation, we will explore both the scientific and social roles of modelling to explore what “responsible modelling” looks like in epidemiology.
Together, we aim to:

Contrast key issues in technical model evaluation across different epidemiological contexts, from long-term control programmes to real-time outbreak response
Explore the role of values and biases in modelling choices, and consider evaluating modelling as a decision-making tool
Build connections among a community of practice committed to responsible modelling in epidemiology

We plan an interactive mix of expert-led talks and experience-led discussion. Enrollment is limited to 50 participants to facilitate discussion.

Organised by Kath Sherratt (LSHTM), Seb Funk (LSHTM), and Erica Thompson (UCL), and supported by LSHTM CMMID

title: Register
text:
